Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can an immigration officer deny a humanitarian and compassionate grounds application based on illegal work and residence?
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of immigration officer's decision
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Exemptions for humanitarian and compassionate reasons are discretionary
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds for permanent residence
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Illegal work and residence after refugee claim denial
Crimes.Application_Factor: Unauthorized employment and residence considered negative factors
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refusal of humanitarian and compassionate application
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Use of illegal activities as a factor in refusal
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Discretionary exemptions under humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Applicants worked and resided illegally after refugee claim denial
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Misrepresentation in border or immigration documents
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that irrelevant considerations were used

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Is working without authorization a valid consideration in denying an application for permanent residence on humanitarian and compassionate grounds?
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of immigration officer's decision
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Self-sufficiency is not guaranteed if pursued illegally
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds for permanent residence
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Unauthorized work despite being instructed to cease
Crimes.Application_Factor: Unauthorized work weighed against family ties and adaptation
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refusal of humanitarian and compassionate application
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Relevance of unauthorized work in decision-making
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Canadian immigration law on legal means of self-sufficiency
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Unauthorized work and lack of unusual hardship
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Argument that irrelevant factors were considered

Crimes.Violation_Type: Unlawful presence after refugee claim denial
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can applicants who worked illegally in Canada be granted permanent residence on humanitarian and compassionate grounds?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicants remained in Canada and worked illegally after refugee status was denied
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Refusal of humanitarian and compassionate application
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Permanent residence on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Illegal activities cannot justify a humanitarian exemption
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Continued residence and work without authorization
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Adaptation to Canadian life, family ties
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Exemption requires legal pursuit of self-sufficiency
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Lack of financial sponsorship and illegal conduct
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Record of unauthorized work and residence
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Duration of stay, work history, integration efforts
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Humanitarian exemptions do not override illegal conduct
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicants overstayed visa and worked illegally post-refusal
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Immigration Act â€“ unlawful presence and work
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Failure to comply with residency conditions
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Illegal actions should not be rewarded under humanitarian grounds
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Discretionary humanitarian exemptions require lawful conduct
